alert.note: Alert for Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 5:32AM EST until January 11 at 5:18AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Pennsylvania, including the following county, Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 528 AM EST, the gage at Pennypack is showing moderate flooding with the gage close to cresting. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Moderate flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - For Pennypack Creek at Pennypack: At 5:20am the stage was 10.41 feet. Flood Stage is 7 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
